clinical_study.brief_title: Supplementation of Vitamin D in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes and Hypertension
clinical_study.official_title: Supplementation of Vitamin D in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes and Hypertension: Randomized Clinical Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Hospital de Clinicas de Porto Alegre

collaborator.agency: Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul

clinical_study.source: Hospital de Clinicas de Porto Alegre

brief_summary.textblock: In patients with type 2 diabetes, the effects on blood pressure of vitamin D has been shown to be variable. Thus, the goal of this proposal is to evaluate the effect of vitamin D supplementation in patients with type 2 diabetes and hypertension

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This study was a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled clinical trial on 40 outpatients with hypertension and type 2 diabetes were recruited. Patients were allocated into two equal groups of 20 by computer-generated randomly permutated codes. the subjects were randomly assigned to 1 of 2 groups: Group 1 received a single dose (100.000 IU) of oral supplementation with cholecalciferol (vitamin D3). Group 2 received matching placebo capsules containing microcrystalline cellulose.

primary_outcome.description: Blood pressure will be assessed by Ambulatory Blood Pressure Monitoring before and after vitamin D supplementation

arm_group.description: supplementation of 100.000 IU of vitamin D3

intervention.intervention_name: supplementation of 100.000 IU of vitamin D3
intervention.description: supplementation of vitamin D ( with 2 pills of Addera D3 (50.000IU each pill))
intervention.other_name: supplementation of 100.000 IU of vitamin D3: Addera D3 (50.000IU each pill)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- type 2 diabetes
- hypovitaminosis D
- hypertension
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnant or lactating
- patients using vitamin D supplementation
- using drugs that interfere on vitamin D metabolism (corticosteroids, anticonvulsants)
- illicit drug use
- diseases such as chronic renal failure (serum creatinine greater than 2.0 mg/dl)
- liver cirrhosis
- alcoholism
- dementia
- malignant disease that compromises the 5-year survival,
- digestive tract (malabsorption) diseases
- BMI> 40 kg / m2
